data.text: Shoes for Off-The-Bike use when Bikepacking/Camping?

Hi I'm looking for recommendations for easy to pack footwear that I can use in the evenings on a mountain bike backing trip. This would be for walking to the pub etc. I don't want to rely on my mountain biking shoes as they may be wet and muddy, given that I'll be in Scotland and I've heard it sometimes rains!
Good luck having room for spare shoes. It was hard enough squeezing in a spare pair of socks and pants for me!
data.author: Emma Downey

data.text: Crocs, look stupid but perfect for bike packing, light and comfortable and easy to carry
data.author: Wayne Coombs

data.text: .... and don't soak up water ! Dry in seconds ! I can't see the problem with them ? Ideal !! 👍
data.author: Peter Couttie

data.text: I take them on every bike packing and canoeing trip! As you said they are ideal!👍👍👍
data.author: Wayne Coombs

data.text: and you can use them to cross burns, in suspect showers etc etc
data.author: Kirsty Cambridge

data.text: and no matter what weird shape they get squashed into depending where you stash them - they unfold themselves back to normal! 😂
data.author: Graeme Dunbar

data.text: It's a win , win !! 👍
data.author: Peter Couttie

data.text:
Swimming Water Shoes Mens Womens... https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B082FVWXD3?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share I took these with me, don’t do anything to keep your feet dry, but they do dry quickly and nice to get out of bike shoes for the evenings.
Water Shoes Swimming Mens Womens Summer Swim Barefoot Socks Skin Shoes for Beach Snorkeling Surfing Diving Yoga Exercise
amazon.co.uk
data.author: Morgan Jones

data.text: +1 for Crocs-type footwear, as they are light (thought may not be suitable for really boggin' weather). Also, look for barefoot shoes as they are minimalist design and can be rolled up.
data.author: David Rowe
Wayne Coombs

data.text: what is this amazing contraption?! 🤩
data.author: Bethany Bexon
Wayne Coombs

data.text: floor dwelling is not for me when I can get in my hammock and sleep like a baby if theres a forrest near my bivi spot.This hammock has a built in bug net of the midges come on top, you can use it or you don’t have to, there’s a pocket hanging from top to put my phone and bit me and pieces in, try a hammock you won’t look back 🚴‍♀️🚴‍♀️👍👍
data.author: Wayne Coombs

data.text: what hammock is that, where from.
data.author: John Cooper

data.text: it’s a DD frontline XL, you can get them off the internet 👍👍Great bit of kit
data.author: Wayne Coombs

data.text: thanks Wayne, looks like you got it nailed there pal. 👍
data.author: John Cooper

data.text: it’s so comfortable, you will definitely be looking for pine Forrest’s on the O/S maps while planning your routes 👍👍🚴‍♀️🚴‍♀️
data.author: Wayne Coombs

data.text: 🍻😴

data.text: Fitkicks or water shoes!
data.author: Joel Turner

data.text: Definitely water shoes

data.text: Chaos
data.author: Darin Dunn

data.text: I biked from Alaska to Argentina in my Chacos. Rain covers. I had no issues
data.author: Darin Dunn

data.text: Try Vivo barefoots, they crunch up not much bigger than flip flops and are really comfy
data.author: Dave Branston

data.text: thanks will give them a try as I’m less keen on Crocks and other sandals
data.author: Marcus Hearle

data.text: Vivobarefoot (expensive but good) or something like saguaro, whitin on Amazon, all fold up small. For sandals/flipflop the xero genesis are brilliant, weigh 130 grams and fold up tiny.
data.author: Nick Luton

data.text: thanks I’m tempted by the barefoot shoes. On a cold wet evening in Aviemore I’d rather not be wearing sandals
data.author: Marcus Hearle

data.text: fair point! 😂 I miss Aviemore, when my dad was stationed at RAF Lossiemouth we spent lots of time there. I use the Amazon ones for the gym and can fold them into my jersey pockets with a hair elastic round them.
data.author: Nick Luton
